intro: Thesium pratense, commonly known as the common thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, grassy habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flower clusters. Its flowers are usually arranged in dense, terminal spikes, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Thesium pratense is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
